Name: DiGeorge syndrome
Definition: A T cell deficiency disease that is the result of a large deletion of chromosome 22 which includes the DGS gene needed for development of the thymus and related glands with subsequent lack of T-cell production.

Name: Cri-Du-Chat syndrome
Definition: A Chagas disease that involves deterioration of the function of the myocardium caused due to Trypanosoma cruzi infection

Name: velocardiofacial syndrome
Definition: A chromosomal disease that has_material_basis_in deletion polymorphisms at chromosome location 22q11 and is characterized by variable developmental problems and schizoid features.

Name: obsolete Diabetes mellitus of mother
Definition: A chromosomal disease that has_material_basis_in deletion polymorphisms at chromosome location 22q11 and is characterized by variable developmental problems and schizoid features.
Synonym: Diabetes mellitus during pregnancy - baby delivered (disorder)

Name: WAGR syndrome
Definition: A chromosomal deletion syndrome that is a nephroblastoma that results_in a rare genetic syndrome in which affected children are predisposed to develop Wilms tumor

Name: obsolete Idiopathic cysts of iris and ciliary body
Definition: A chromosomal deletion syndrome that is a nephroblastoma that results_in a rare genetic syndrome in which affected children are predisposed to develop Wilms tumor

Name: obsolete adenovirus gastroenteritis
Definition: An adenovirus infectious disease that involves damage of the cells in the lining of the stomach and intestines caused by adenoviruses (types 40 and 41). The symptoms include watery diarrhea

Name: obsolete cutaneous breast cancer
Definition: An adenovirus infectious disease that involves damage of the cells in the lining of the stomach and intestines caused by adenoviruses (types 40 and 41). The symptoms include watery diarrhea

Name: thrombocytopenia-absent radius syndrome
Definition: A galactosemia that involves an accumulation of galactose and galactitol secondary to the decreased conversion of galactose to galactose-1-phosphate by galactokinase.

Name: Williams-Beuren syndrome
Definition: A lipid storage disease characterized by functional deficiencies in the enzymes needed for lysosomal degradation of sphingolipid substrates.
